sections.heading: Referees; how chosen; number.In all cases of reference, the parties, except when an infant may be a party, may agree upon a suitable person or persons, not exceeding three, and the reference shall be ordered accordingly; and if the parties do not agree, the court shall appoint one or more referees,
sections.text: Referees; how chosen; number.In all cases of reference, the parties, except when an infant may be a party, may agree upon a suitable person or persons, not exceeding three, and the reference shall be ordered accordingly; and if the parties do not agree, the court shall appoint one or more referees, not exceeding three, who shall be free from exception.SourceR.S.1867, Code § 301, p. 445;R.S.1913, § 7870;C.S.1922, § 8815;C.S.1929, § 20-1132;R.S.1943, § 25-1132.AnnotationsFailure to object to qualifications of referee until after approval of report precluded attack on that ground. Corn Belt Products Co. v. Mullins, 172 Neb. 561, 110 N.W.2d 845 (1961).
